1.description: A witcher on his way to collect payment for a contract. His two swords are stolen early in the story, setting off a chain of events.

5.description: Becomes embroiled in the politics of Kerack and the machinations of sorcerers while trying to recover his stolen swords.

3.description: A powerful sorceress with red hair who takes an interest in Geralt. Known for her fiery temper and significant magical abilities.

1.description: Geralt's bardic friend who gets into trouble early in the story, contributing to the theft of Geralt's swords.

5.description: The King of Kerack who hires Geralt for a dangerous mission. Has multiple sons vying for succession.

6.description: The elder prince of Kerack, involved in succession intrigue. Ambitious and ruthless.
The younger prince of Kerack, also involved in succession politics.

4.description: A wizard involved in the conspiracy surrounding Geralt's stolen swords. Has his own agenda.

9.description: A sorcerer at Rissberg who becomes involved in Geralt's investigation of magical experiments.

14.description: A young woman who claims to be Geralt's apprentice. Brave but inexperienced, she gets involved in Geralt's adventures.

23.description: A sorceress from the future who appears in the epilogue, studying the legend of Geralt of Rivia.

19.description: A shape-shifting fox spirit that Geralt encounters. Can take human form and has its own agenda.

9.description: A professor at Oxenfurt Academy who provides Geralt with information about magical phenomena.

10.description: A sorceress involved in the Rissberg experiments. Has knowledge of dangerous magical research.

2.description: One of the bandits who steals Geralt's swords at the beginning of the story.
The leader of the bandits who steal Geralt's swords. More intelligent than typical bandits.

recaps.1: Geralt and Dandelion are traveling when they encounter trouble at an inn, leading to Geralt's swords being stolen.
recaps.2: The thieves who stole Geralt's swords are revealed, and Geralt begins tracking them down.
recaps.3: Geralt meets the sorceress Coral (Lytta Neyd) who offers to help him recover his swords.
recaps.4: The conspiracy behind the sword theft deepens as more sorcerers become involved.
recaps.5: Geralt is hired by King Belohun of Kerack for a dangerous mission while still searching for his swords.
recaps.6: Political intrigue in Kerack intensifies as the king's sons vie for succession.
recaps.7: Geralt navigates the dangerous politics of the royal court while pursuing his own goals.
recaps.8: The mission for King Belohun leads to unexpected complications and revelations.
recaps.9: Geralt investigates magical experiments at Rissberg, encountering dangerous sorcerers.
recaps.10: The dark nature of the Rissberg experiments is revealed, involving forbidden magic.
recaps.11: Geralt confronts those responsible for the magical experiments and their connection to his stolen swords.
recaps.12: A battle with rogue sorcerers tests Geralt's skills without his proper weapons.
recaps.13: The aftermath of the Rissberg incident leads to new complications.
recaps.14: Mozaïk appears, claiming to be Geralt's apprentice, adding complexity to his journey.
recaps.15: Geralt returns to Kerack to resolve unfinished business with the royal family.
recaps.16: Coral and Geralt's relationship deepens as they face danger together.
recaps.17: Dandelion returns to the story, bringing both help and trouble.
recaps.18: The group faces a new threat that requires all their combined skills.
recaps.19: Geralt encounters the Aguara, a shape-shifting fox spirit with its own agenda.
recaps.20: The confrontation with the Aguara reveals deeper magical mysteries.
recaps.21: The various plot threads begin to converge toward a resolution.
recaps.22: Geralt finally recovers his swords and settles all accounts.
recaps.23: An epilogue set in the future shows Nimue studying the legend of Geralt, placing his adventures in historical context.
